## Test Results Summary

```{julia}
#| echo: false
#| output: asis
status = get_cache_status()
if status.exists
    total = status.total_passed + status.total_failed + status.total_errors
    pass_rate = total > 0 ? round(100 * status.total_passed / total, digits=1) : 0.0
    
    println("""
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Passed** | $(status.total_passed) |
| **Failed** | $(status.total_failed) |
| **Errors** | $(status.total_errors) |
| **Pass Rate** | $(pass_rate)% |
| **Categories** | $(length(status.categories)) |
| **Last Updated** | $(status.last_updated) |
""")
else
    println("*No cached test results available.*")
end
```

## Quick Start

### Building Reports Locally

```bash
cd MultistateModelsTests/reports
quarto render
```

### Running Tests and Recording Results

```bash
# Run full test suite with automatic cache recording
julia --project=. -e 'using MultistateModelsTests; MultistateModelsTests.runtests()'

# Or run with the dedicated script
julia --project=. scripts/run_all_tests.jl
```

Test results are automatically cached when running via `runtests()`.

### Checking Cache Status

```bash
julia --project=. scripts/refresh_cache.jl
```
